I arrived around 6pm and the place was empty with the exception of one other party. We were immediately sat and drink orders taken.  We then placed our food orders. The food was good. The sashimi was fresh, delicious and cut into bite sized pieces.  The price was excellent. The servers were attentive but not intrusive. A wonderful experience and I shall return.

Diners beware this is a small place and by 6:30pm the place was packed and customers either waited or were turned away.

Can't understand why this place would ever get over 2 stars at best.  Food was meh at best, you could get better shrimp tempura from your local grocery frozen section - which I'm almost sure is what they use.  My bill was close to $30 for a shrimp tempura appetizer, miso soup, a cup of green tea and Hamachi kama, not a good deal at all.

Mikado really surprised me.  I didn't expect to find a Japanese restaurant so close to home with a nice atmosphere and pretty good food...but here it is! 

Sushi is really the thing here.  The tempura is good although the shrimp tempura had an odd coating that didn't match the veggies and it didn't seem like authentic tempura.  Miso soup is pretty good too.

But go for the sushi.  They're all about the sushi here.
My kids and I love this place!  Service....excellent!  Sushi.....flavorful and fresh!  Great prices on meals and sushi! Spicy tuna is our favorite menu item!

I can't believe no one has reviewed Mikado!  Probably because no one can find Mikado....hmmm...

I tried this place one night for dinner just after my husband and I moved to Chandler.  We were sick of the chain restaurant hell that is Chandler and decided Mikado looked good.  It's hard to find though if you don't know it's there.  It's in a shopping center at Alma School and Queen Creek (southeast corner of the intersection).  I used to get my nails done at a place in the same center so I'd seen it and I love sushi so, why not?

It definitely seemed to be a locals place and seemed pretty authentic (not Ra trendy).  My favorite that night was the Caterpillar Roll.  It was so cute and the chef had actually arranged it on a plate to look like a caterpillar, complete with sprouts for antennae.

Mikado is definitely worth the trip.

As a fan of MythBusters I am delighted to say I have officially busted a myth....there's no good sushi in Phoenix.  Not true--You can indeed find great sushi in Phoenix, Arizona (Chandler, to be more specific).  Stopped by Mikado for lunch today.  My very favorite way to take in a sushi date is by sitting at the counter and asking the artist behind the bar to send out suggestions.  It was recommended we start with some great blue fin tuna (hooray for October, as it is the beginning of the season).  Next up, a house specialty...Salmon Avocado Sashimi.  What makes it particularly great is the homemade Eel Sauce made in-house.  Delicately sweet and still lets the fish flavors come through.  We just had to finish up with the Dragon Roll to get our Unagi fix.  So glad we did.  We will definitely be back to Mikado (and by "we" I mean my hard to please 15 year old son and me.)

We've been coming here for 8 years. The last time the service was horribly slow. It took over 20 minutes to get our check. Last night, we decided to give it another shot. Our family of three stood waiting for over 5 minutes. There was no line. No one greeted us, no one made eye contact, although four employees working in the dining area were within plain sight and clearly walked in front of our family. There were 5 open tables and we were completely ignored. We left, discouraged and choose an alternating dining experience. There are too many good dining establishment to choose from to tolerate this treatment. Mikado needs to work on service!

Delicious, fresh and I must add a very generous portion of Hamachi!! I will return!!

I normally have a mid day snack and this spot is perfect for that. Great service and great fish!!

When we first moved to Ocotillo the first thing we did was peruse yelp for the best local eateries. Mikado was one of the first things to splash onto our radar and we had to check it out. Luckily for us Mikado is literally a 2 minute drive from our house. :)

The restaurant is low-key and I like how the lighting is a little dimmer than usual to create a more mellow ambience. The servers are all very attentive and kind which makes the eating experience so much more enjoyable. 

So anyway, on to the sushi! I adore sushi rolls with some kind of crunch in them which is why I love anything tempura. The Big Shrimp Tempura Roll is my favorite and it could stand alone as a meal because it's so ginormous. They stuff 3 large tempura shrimp in there with avocado and cucumber then drizzle it with eel sauce. LOVE! And while I'm on the subject, Mikado has mastered the art of frying up a perfect tempura. Their tempura shrimp is super crispy, isn't greasy and always fresh out of the fryer. The Crunch Roll is superb, the salad dressing is addictive and the chicken noodle udon soup is delicious. Their prices are great and you still get so much food. How can you go wrong? If you're within a 20 mile radius of Mikado you need to stop by.

Also, I can't say this enough: Please support your local businesses! They depend on your patronage!

Good lunch spot. We always order the bento boxes, either the 3 option for me or the 4 option for my guy.

Our fave picks are the quid salad, tempura, white fish sashimi, tuna rolls and the chicken terriyaki. Good prices as it comes with soup as well.

I am always happy with the service and food here.  I usually get one of the spicy rolls, and or some tempura.  I came with my mom, and she really liked the chicken teriyaki,  They were also giving out samples of some new chicken they were trying.  It was very good as well.  It's a solid place to come for sushi.  Casual atmosphere.

Well I like thier lunch deal. 4 items for $11.95. Chicken teriyaki was good... a lil dry but still good. The tempura was different than i'm used to but still decent. miso soup yum and the spicy yellowtail roll was pretty great. The white tuna sashimi was simply amazingness!!!!!!!
Good lunch combos. Nice sushi rolls and I love the vegetable tempura and gyoza.

I write this review with the caveat that Arizona has to fly or truck in any seafood so it's obvious the quality of seafood is going to be somewhat lower in comparison to where I come from, Seattle, or any other coastal city. 

I've been searching for a good sushi since my girlfriend and I moved here from Seattle -- one would say we've been spoiled with Sushi. We tried Teharu upon our roommate's/several coworkers' suggestions when we first got here and liked it, but craved something better than the standard belt-centric kind of place... we needed more than that. 

I found Mikado via Google maps search for "sushi restaurants near Chandler" and was attracted to the vast menu options and decently laid out website. I showed my girlfriend and she also agreed it was worth a try so we went out there.

We ordered the Boston (Philly) Roll, Salmon Roll, Salmon Teriyaki and Chicken Teriyaki (Teriyaki is always a good baseline indicator for restaurants, especially in Arizona). 

The rolls were well constructed by a Sushiman behind the bar where they serve all kinds of beer, sake, homemade Green Tea, etc. The Green Tea was refreshingly light. The sushi didn't fall apart and tasted great. We preferred the Boston Roll over the Salmon Roll, and the Salmon Teriyaki over the Chicken version. Nothing we ordered was bad which is always a plus. The restaurant offered extra rice if necessary and Miso Soup. The server was also very polite. Yes, the food came out in reasonable time. 

The atmosphere is comfortable and welcoming, nothing too elegant or intimidating. It reminded me a lot of those teriyaki joints up in Seattle that had been around forever but have been recently renovated. 

It is a little deep location-wise (buried in Ocotillo off Alma School/Queen Creek) but I think that keeps the restaurant from getting super busy and crowded. 

Overall, the place isn't 100% perfect but I would highly recommend it to anyone new to the area or anyone simply looking for a better sushi spot around town.

My bf and I came here for happy hour which was around 3pm. The prices on sushi for happy hour is reasonable. Not pricey or anything. Sushi is okay. Its not great but not bad either. It could be better though. Some of the rolls we ordered were bland. I also ordered their miso soup. The miso soup is a little salty. I would recommend not to put too much next time. Otherwise it would have been perfect. Service was good. The server checked on us often. I might be back to give this place another chance. Hopefully, sushi and miso will be better next time I visit.

Went here for the first time Friday night. Horrible service. We were not greeted or acknowledged for what seemed almost 5 minutes. Finally after being seated we were given menus. Prices are pretty reasonable didn't see much of a happy hour menu so not sure if it's offered. After ordering an appetizer and sushi... We received our appetizer (edamame) very long after ordering... Strange as there is not much preparation that goes with it. Our sushi took triple the time to come out. Sushi was good so that is why I gave it 2 stars. Never once did our server apologize or come back to refill our water. Not a place I would visit again. Overall hated the service, the atmosphere and the overall experience.

I enjoyed this place. It's decent Sushi in AZ and it even appears to be owned and staffed by... wait for it... ACTUAL JAPANESE people. As opposed to 95% of sushi places owned/run by Koreans who memorized "Hello', "Thanks", and "Cheers' in Japanese and attempt to trick their customers by pretending to be Japanese.

Too bad this place is so far south it's practically Casa Grande adjacent.

This is an excellent restaurant that I believe may be run by Korean folks who bring their own flavors to the meals.  The seaweed is a little tastier, the tempura batter and sauce are sweeter, they may put sesame oil in food, etc.  I am Japanese and insisted on staying with a more traditional Japanese cuisine but after trying Mikado's food, i'm hooked!  If you can handle a little spice, I recommend the STST roll (shrimp tempura, spicy tuna).  Their sushi is creative, fresh and tasty.  The prices are excellent and the service is prompt and friendly.  Go check it out, you won't be disappointed!

I'm a regular foodie of Japanese food.  Definitely have had my experience with a wide variety of Japanese cuisine from Fast food to fine dining.  This restaurant has mediocre food and service.  Small variety of fish selections and skimped on fish quality  (low grade and ultra thin slices ) and service.  The service is not friendly enough nor thoughtful or helpful enough to feel like a neighborhood place.

Mikado is a cute little sushi place located on Queen Creek and Alma School. I pass it every day on the way to and from work and always wanted to check it out. On Monday I stopped in for lunch and they have some good lunch specials, they have your typical sushi/sashimi specials as well as teriyaki specials, katsu, and tempura specials but I went for the bento box. You can choose from two, three, or four choices and it comes with miso soup, steamed rice, and a drink. I ordered chicken teriyaki, gyoza, and a spicy salmon roll. The cuts of chicken were a little off (long, narrow strips) and overcooked but not to the point where I couldn't eat my food, the chicken just could have been better. Everything else was delicious though, the spicy salmon roll was one of the better rolls I've had in Arizona. The service was quick and attentive and it was pretty busy for 1 o'clock on a Monday. I'd definitely come back again for lunch or for dinner.

So incredibly bad.This is not a 4 star restaurant.

The service - The guy wanted to give us a 2 top for 4 of us (2 adults & 2 toddlers). I asked him for a 4 top because you can't keep toddlers from grabbing things off the table if they can reach across the whole thing. He REALLY did not want to give us a bigger table, although the restaurant only had 4 tables of people.

The food - The Dynamite Roll was awful. It was watery and fell apart and the scallops were disgusting. The chicken was cooked well, so that was really the only part we enjoyed. The rolls are tiny compared to other places I've been around here. The sushi was awful.

The atmosphere - There was a drunk doctor in a booth, screaming about how he hates this woman and that woman that he works with. They never asked him to quiet down or stopped serving him beer.

I would stop eating sushi if this was the last sushi place on earth.

Lunchtime during the week can be really slow. Almost two hours for four people ordering lunch combos. This is because they are severely understaffed. Only two servers for the whole restaurant? Other than that the lunch combos are a decent value and the chicken cutlet is good.
This is an awesome sushi spot. Prices are fair and the food was good. The cheif was nice and accommodating. Although, most of the servers spoke broken English.

This is a great little lunch place and the service is fantastic! There is a nice lunch menu, good prices, TVs, lots of seating and the staff is always energetic and friendly. I am not a sushi person but my friend loved what he ordered off the sushi menu. The menu is HUGE and there are so many different and unique plates. I like getting the mixed tempura or a teriyaki dish. It's also pretty quiet and laid back. We always get in and out quickly too.

Best sushi I have had in Arizona and it's for a great price.  The white tuna is the special key here at this sushi place.  I don't know any other place that has such delicious white tuna or even have white tuna.  The sushi is also very fresh and the pieces are thick.  I really enjoy getting their sashimi combo dish.  

Unfortunately, they do not give any complimentary desserts for birthdays.  They did, however, make my mom a bear with an orange (quite cute!)

We are regulars here whether it be to sit down or take out. They let us sit wherever we want and are always so nice. I never feel rushed eating here. Great, calm environment. Sushi is always fresh and comes out quick. I recommend this place to everyone.
Amazing, amazing, amazing. I love their cucumber salad, their tempura is delicious without being soggy, the bento combos are adorable and overflowing with food.. and oh yeah, the sushi is AMAZING.

Service when it came was good.  But folks got lost for a while so it took a bit for someone to actually show up to take our order, which was odd since the place was near empty.

As for the food, I had relatively low expectations for sushi in Arizona so I was willing to be generous.  Having said that, the food was merely adequate...neither bad, nor good.  But what was really weird was that everything (keep in mind we're talking sushi here) came out warm.  I gotta admit that was a first for sushi I've had anywhere...and that covers a lot of territory around the world.

This small Japanese restaurant serves freshly made sushi, sashimi, and a wide variety of other traditional dishes that are well prepared.  The staff is very helpful. Their happy hour is great and their prices are inexpensive for what you get..  I usually order off of the combination menu that allows you to build your meal with  I, 2 , 3, or 4 selections, depending on how hungry you are.

Sushi is average but has great customer service. If you like Fried Tofu, you must order it at this place. It is simply amazing and I order it every time I go there. Their lunch and dinner special has good prices.

Top notch the best sushi in a long time, 5 of us went to.eat , and not 1 person was  unappy , still raved about it next day , verry very good, best happy hour deal 4 til 6 pm , amazing  , $118  for the 5 people lots of saki n beer and ton of food
